intro: Pedicularis lingelsheimiana, commonly known as the Alpine Lousewort, is a flowering plant native to the alpine regions of Europe. It belongs to the Orobanchaceae family, which includes many parasitic and hemiparasitic species. The plant is characterized by its vibrant red or orange flowers, which are often clustered in racemes. It typically grows in rocky or mountainous habitats, thriving in cool, moist environments. Due to its specific ecological requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species in many parts of its range.
